problem: Given a regular heptagon (7-sided polygon) inscribed in a circle of diameter 14 cm, find the side length of the heptagon. Give the answer in decimal and round to 2 decimal places
solution: The side length $s$ of a regular polygon inscribed in a circle of radius $r$ can be calculated by $s = 2r \sin(\pi/n)$. Here, the diameter is 14 cm, so the radius $r = 7$ cm. For a heptagon, $n = 7$. Therefore, $s = 2 \times 7 \times \sin(\pi/7) = 14 \times \sin(\pi/7)$. Using a calculator, $\sin(\pi/7) \approx 0.4339$, thus $s \approx 14 \times 0.4339 = 6.0746$ cm. \(\boxed{6.07}\)
